page.title: 02EMPLOYMENT
page.content:
There are five farmers in Snelland and two in the hamlet of Reasby. Of the working population, a large proportion travel to Lincoln or elsewhere, working in offices, factories or similar. This necessitates owning a car.
Others are farmworkers in the immediate locality.
In Snelland village there is a blacksmith who is self employed, doing farm repair work and decorative wrought iron work.
The level crossings at Snelland and Stainton/Reasby are both manually operated. The crossing keepers do not live in Snelland or Reasby.
